meanings.definition: A group of soldiers stationed at a particular point to stand guard or prevent the passage of unauthorized persons.
meanings.sent1: The picquets kept watch throughout the night to protect the camp.
meanings.sent2: The general ordered the picquets to be vigilant at all times.
meanings.sent3: The picquets decided to play a game of cards to pass the time on duty.
meanings.sent4: The picquets stood like statues, ready to defend their post at any cost.
meanings.sent5: The picquets' presence was a reassuring sight for the weary travelers.

meanings.definition: A stake or peg used for marking a boundary or for tethering animals.
meanings.sent1: She hammered the picquets into the ground to secure the fence.
meanings.sent2: The rancher used picquets to keep the horses from wandering off.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous goat managed to chew through the picquets and escape.
meanings.sent4: The picquets lined the field like guardians of the farmer's land.
meanings.sent5: The colorful ribbons tied to the picquets fluttered in the breeze.

meanings.definition: A game in which players try to score points by hitting a wooden ball through a series of hoops using a mallet.
meanings.sent1: The children enjoyed a friendly game of picquets in the park.
meanings.sent2: Picquets requires skill and precision to win against opponents.
meanings.sent3: During the picquets match, a squirrel ran off with the ball!
meanings.sent4: The sound of the mallet striking the ball echoed across the picquets field.
meanings.sent5: The sun set as the players competed in a thrilling game of picquets.
